item.title: Rolling Motion
item.description: Topic: Angular Motion Rolling Motion Rolling motion occurs when there is translational and angular motion. For it to occur without slipping, v_{cm} = R \omega Where v_{cm} is the velocity of the center of mass, R is the radius of the rolling object, and \omega is the Angular Velocity.

item.title: Law of Conservation of Linear Momentum
item.description: Law of Conservation of Linear Momentum Topic: Linear Momentum Conservation of Linear Momentum If the net external force acting on a system is zero, then the total linear momentum ...

item.title: Wave Intensity
item.description: Topic: Waves Wave Intensity The intensity of a wave is defined as the average Power transported across a unit area perpendicular to the direction of Energy flow: I = \frac{\overline{P}}{\overline{S}} ...

item.title: Waves
item.description: Waves Waves are disturbances that move, carrying energy but not matter. They come in many, many forms, including light waves, ocean waves, Sound Waves, and Electromagnetic Radiation.

item.title: Transverse Waves
item.description: Transverse Waves particles move perpendicular to the waveâ€™s direction .

item.title: Simple Pendulum
item.description: Topic: SHM Simple Pendulum A simple pendulum is a system consisting of a rod of length \ell, at the end of which all mass is concentrated. An example is a very thin string, such that its mass is negligible, with a very dense metal ball at the end.

item.title: Simple Harmonic Motion
item.description: Simple Harmonic Motion Simple harmonic motion relies on two key facts: Must have some equilibrium position If disturbed, experiences a linear restoring force which acts to return ...

item.title: Resonance
item.description: Topic: SHM Resonance An object has a natural Frequency, at which it undergoes Simple Harmonic Motion. For a Simple Pendulum, this is \omega = \sqrt{\frac{g}{\ell}}.

item.title: Physical Pendulum
item.description: Topic: Simple Harmonic Motion Physical Pendulum A physical pendulum is a pendulum where the mass is distributed, not concentrated at the end as with a ball on string (Simple Pendulum) ...

item.title: Mass On A Spring
item.description: Topic: SHM Mass On A Spring A mass on a spring is one of the most quintessential examples of Simple Harmonic Motion, and involves a system with a Mass suspended on the very end of a spring ...
